location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 9/1 A III Visit of Commander-in-Chief to Muscat'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the rear to the front.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 55, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: Correspondence and other papers relating to visits by the Commander-in-Chief, East Indies Station, to Muscat. The file covers a visit in early 1950 and a proposed visit in early 1951 which was later cancelled. The papers deal with matters such as notifying the Sultan of Muscat, the programme of events for the visits, lists of officers aboard visiting ships, and appropriate gun salutes. A proposed visit in May 1950 of the Senior Naval Officer in the Persian Gulf, Bahrain, is also discussed. Vessels mentioned in the file include HMS Wild Gooseand Mauritius. A report on the Commander-in-Chief's visit by Major Frederick Charles Leslie Chauncy, Political Agent and Consul, Muscat, 6 February 1950, is included in the file (folio 31).Correspondence comes from: the Senior Naval Officer in the Persian Gulf, Bahrain; the Political Agency, Muscat; the Persian Gulf Residency, Bahrain; Said bin Taimur [Sa‘īd ibn Taymūr Āl Bū Sa‘īd], Sultan of Muscat; and Basil Woods Ballard, Minister for Foreign Affairs, Muscat.

name.namePart: Royal Navy, Commander-in-Chief, East Indies Station
Sultan of Muscat and Oman, Āl Bū Sa'īd Dynasty
